intro: Cylindropsis togolana, commonly known as the African horned vulture plant, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest edges, adapting to the region's tropical climate. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. Cylindropsis togolana is also notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
